name: Jira Group permission ignore non legacy instance

inline.description:
1. Use /cloud to create a Mattermost sever with an E20 license
2. Login to the new MM server and install the Jira V2.4 plugin
inline.expectedResult: The instance select drop down is shown along with the 2 connected instances

customFields.Important notes about this step: There are several other valid ways this could be setup on existing Mattermost servers

inline.description:
1. Type /Jira install <cloud or server> <Jira URL>
ex: /jira install cloud https://mmtest.atlassian.net
2. Type /jira instance connect <jira URL> to connect to the newly installed instance
inline.expectedResult: Instance is successfully installed and user can connect

inline.description:
1. Migrate the instance by upgrading the plugin to Jira V3
2. Type /jira instance list
inline.expectedResult: Table shows that legacy instance has been migrated

inline.description:
1. Type /jira instance install <cloud / server> <jira URL> to install a 2nd instance of Jira
2. Type /jira instance connect <jira URL> to connect to the newly installed instance
1. Open the Jira config and add a Jira permission group that does not exists in either instance such as `not-a-real-group`
inline.expectedResult: Jira group permission added to restrict subscription functionality

- Legacy Jira instance is no longer available for subscriptions functionality as the group does not exist
- Subscribe functionality for 2nd Jira instance is nor affected by Kira permission group restriction
